com.blukii.sdk.info

Class DiscoverySettings

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.blukii.sdk.info.DiscoverySettings

  • public final class DiscoverySettings
extends java.lang.Object

    Property set of settings to configure the discovering process.



    The DiscoverySettings properties are affecting the discovery process that is started by BlukiiClient.initDiscovery(BlukiiClient.OnDiscoveryListener) and the DiscoveryData contents of the result callbacks.

    You can access the DiscoverySettings by calling BlukiiClient.getDiscoverySettings().

    Every settings value is writable and has a default value that is used if not changed by the developer.
    See Also:
    BlukiiClient.initDiscovery(BlukiiClient.OnDiscoveryListener), BlukiiClient.getDiscoverySettings(), DiscoveryData

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int RSSI_DEFAULT
      Default value for rssi threshold: -85.
      static int RSSI_MAX
      Maximum value for rssi threshold: -20.
      static int RSSI_MIN
      Minimum value for rssi threshold: -120.
      static int SCANDURATION_DEFAULT
      Scan duration of one discovery phase: 5000 milliseconds.
      static int SCANDURATIONMAXCOUNT_DEFAULT
      Maximum Number of scan durations after the Bluetooth scanner will be restarted: 4
      static int SCANMODE_BALANCED
      Scan mode with balanced power consumption and scan frequency: ScanSettings.SCAN_MODE_BALANCED.
      static int SCANMODE_LOWLATENCY
      Scan mode with high power consumption and scan frequency: ScanSettings.SCAN_MODE_LOW_LATENCY.
      static int SCANMODE_LOWPOWER
      Scan mode with low power consumption and scan frequency: ScanSettings.SCAN_MODE_LOW_POWER.
      static int SCANTYPE_ALTERNATE
      Scan type: alternating scan duration and scan wait duration.
      static int SCANTYPE_CONTINUOUS
      Scan type: continuous.
      static int SCANTYPE_OFF
      Scan type: off.
      static int SCANWAITDURATION_DEFAULT
      Scan wait duration wait duration between two discovery phases: 15000 milliseconds.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DiscoverySettings

        public DiscoverySettings()

    • Method Detail

      • getBackgroundScanType

        public int getBackgroundScanType()
        Gets the scheduling type of the scan if the app is on background

        The values are integer values and can be:
        • SCANTYPE_OFF: scan is off
        • SCANTYPE_ALTERNATE: after each scan duration scan is pause for one wait duration
        • SCANTYPE_CONTINUOUS: scan is continuously on
        Returns:
        scan type, default for background is SCANTYPE_ALTERNATE
        See Also:
        setBackgroundScanType(int), getForegroundScanType(), getScreenOffScanType()

      • getForegroundScanType

        public int getForegroundScanType()
        Gets the scheduling type of the scan if the app is on foreground

        The values are integer values and can be:
        • SCANTYPE_OFF: scan is off
        • SCANTYPE_ALTERNATE: after each scan duration scan is pause for one wait duration
        • SCANTYPE_CONTINUOUS: scan is continuously on
        Returns:
        scan type, default for foreground is SCANTYPE_CONTINUOUS
        See Also:
        setForegroundScanType(int), getBackgroundScanType(), getScreenOffScanType()

      • getRssiThreshold

        public int getRssiThreshold()
        Gets the rssi threshold for the discovery.

        BLE modules with a higher rssi value will be discovered only.
        Returns:
        rssi threshold value, default is RSSI_DEFAULT
        See Also:
        setRssiThreshold(int), RSSI_MIN, RSSI_MAX, RSSI_DEFAULT

      • getScanDuration

        public int getScanDuration()
        Gets the duration of one discovery phase.

        After the scan duration has finished all scanned BLE data is saved into a List of OutputElement and returned by callback BlukiiClient.OnDiscoveryListener.onDiscoveryResult(ArrayList).

        See also getScanWaitDuration() and getBackgroundScanType() to optimize the discovery concerning power consumption.
        Returns:
        scan duration in milliseconds, default is SCANDURATION_DEFAULT.
        See Also:
        setScanDuration(int), BlukiiClient.OnDiscoveryListener.onDiscoveryResult(ArrayList), getScanWaitDuration(), getForegroundScanType(), getBackgroundScanType(), getScreenOffScanType()

      • getScanDurationMaxCount

        public int getScanDurationMaxCount()
        Maximum Number of scan durations after the Bluetooth LE scanner will be restarted!

        This value only takes affect since Android API 25!

        Up to Android API 24 the Bluetooth LE Scanner will be restartet every scan duration because of reliable scan result.

        Since Android 25 the Bluetooth LE scanner is limited to maximum 5 starts per 30 seconds. So the scanner is running continuously if no wait time is defined.

        By defining the scanDurationMaxCount you can limit the number of scan durations before the Bluetooth LE scanner is nevertheless restartet.
        Returns:
        number of scan durations, default is SCANDURATIONMAXCOUNT_DEFAULT.
        See Also:
        setScanDurationMaxCount(int), getScanDuration()

      • getScanMode

        public int getScanMode()
        Gets the scan mode concerning power consumption and scan frequency.

        The values are integer values derived from the ScanSettings class of the android.bluetooth.le library:
        • SCANMODE_LOWPOWER
        • SCANMODE_BALANCED
        • SCANMODE_LOWLATENCY
        Returns:
        scan mode, default is SCANMODE_BALANCED
        See Also:
        setScanMode(int), SCANMODE_LOWPOWER, SCANMODE_BALANCED, SCANMODE_LOWLATENCY, ScanSettings

      • getScanWaitDuration

        public int getScanWaitDuration()
        Gets the wait duration between two discovery phases. You can use this feature to minimize power consumption if you do not need an continuous scan.

        You have to consider the following states to define when wait duration takes affect:
        • getForegroundScanType(): App is in foreground
        • getBackgroundScanType(): App is in background
        • getScreenOffScanType(): Device screen is off or locked
        Returns:
        scan wait duration in milliseconds, default is SCANWAITDURATION_DEFAULT.
        See Also:
        setScanWaitDuration(int), getScanDuration(), getForegroundScanType(), getBackgroundScanType(), getScreenOffScanType()

      • getScreenOffScanType

        public int getScreenOffScanType()
        Gets the scheduling type of the scan if the app is on screen off (inclusive lock screen)

        The values are integer values and can be:
        • SCANTYPE_OFF: scan is off
        • SCANTYPE_ALTERNATE: after each scan duration scan is pause for one wait duration
        • SCANTYPE_CONTINUOUS: scan is continuously on
        Returns:
        scan type, default for screen off is SCANTYPE_OFF
        See Also:
        setScreenOffScanType(int), getForegroundScanType(), getBackgroundScanType()

      • isCalculatingRssiAverage

        public boolean isCalculatingRssiAverage()
        Gets the state if discovery should calculate the average RSSI of all scanned frames.
        />
        Otherwise the last found RSSI value is returned on DiscoveryData.getRssi()
        Returns:
        true if RSSI average is calculated
        See Also:
        DiscoveryData.getRssi(), setCalculatingRssiAverage(boolean)

      • isScanBeaconSensorData

        public boolean isScanBeaconSensorData()
        Gets the state if discovery should scan for sensor data of blukii beacons.
        />
        If this flag is set OutputElement.getDiscoveryData() may contain a valid BeaconSensorData object.
        />
        Note: This flag is only relevant for blukii beacons
        Returns:
        state if blukii beacon sensor data is scanned, default is true
        See Also:
        OutputElement, BeaconSensorData

      • isScanEddystoneData

        public boolean isScanEddystoneData()
        Gets the state if discovery should scan for Eddystone data.
        />
        If this flag is set OutputElement.getDiscoveryData() may contain a valid EddystoneData object.
        Returns:
        state if Eddystone data is scanned, default is false
        See Also:
        OutputElement, EddystoneData

      • isScanIBeaconData

        public boolean isScanIBeaconData()
        Gets the state if discovery should scan for iBeacon data.
        />
        If this flag is set OutputElement.getDiscoveryData() may contain a valid IBeaconData object.
        Returns:
        state if iBeacon data is scanned, default is false
        See Also:
        OutputElement, IBeaconData

      • isScanNonBlukiis

        public boolean isScanNonBlukiis()
        Gets the state if discovery should scan for non blukii BLE modules. Note: the majority of OutputElement data is only supported for blukii modules: BeaconSensorData, ResolveData and some value of DiscoveryData.
        EddystoneData and IBeaconData is also supported for non blukii modules.
        Returns:
        state if non blukii BLE modules are scanned, default is false
        See Also:
        OutputElement

      • setBackgroundScanType

        public void setBackgroundScanType(int backgroundScanType)
        Sets the scheduling type of the scan if the app is on background

        The values are integer values and can be:
        • SCANTYPE_OFF: scan is off
        • SCANTYPE_ALTERNATE: after each scan duration scan is pause for one wait duration
        • SCANTYPE_CONTINUOUS: scan is continuously on
        Parameters:
        backgroundScanType - scan type, default for background is SCANTYPE_ALTERNATE
        See Also:
        getBackgroundScanType(), setForegroundScanType(int), setScreenOffScanType(int)

      • setCalculatingRssiAverage

        public void setCalculatingRssiAverage(boolean calculatingRssiAverage)
        Sets the state if discovery should calculate the average RSSI of all scanned frames.
        />
        Otherwise the last found RSSI value is returned on DiscoveryData.getRssi()
        Parameters:
        calculatingRssiAverage - state if RSSI average is calculated, default is false
        See Also:
        IBeaconData, isCalculatingRssiAverage()

      • setForegroundScanType

        public void setForegroundScanType(int foregroundScanType)
        Sets the scheduling type of the scan if the app is on foreground

        The values are integer values and can be:
        • SCANTYPE_OFF: scan is off
        • SCANTYPE_ALTERNATE: after each scan duration scan is pause for one wait duration
        • SCANTYPE_CONTINUOUS: scan is continuously on
        Parameters:
        foregroundScanType - scan type, default for foreground is SCANTYPE_CONTINUOUS
        See Also:
        getForegroundScanType(), setBackgroundScanType(int), setScreenOffScanType(int)

      • setRssiThreshold

        public void setRssiThreshold(int rssiThreshold)
        Sets the rssi threshold for the discovery.

        BLE modules with a higher rssi value will be discovered only.

        The valid range for the rssi threshold is limited by RSSI_MIN and RSSI_MAX.
        Parameters:
        rssiThreshold - rssi threshold value, default is RSSI_DEFAULT
        See Also:
        getRssiThreshold(), RSSI_MIN, RSSI_MAX, RSSI_DEFAULT

      • setScanBeaconSensorData

        public void setScanBeaconSensorData(boolean scanBeaconSensorData)
        Sets the state if discovery should scan for sensor data of blukii beacons.
        />
        If this flag is set OutputElement.getDiscoveryData() may contain a valid BeaconSensorData object.
        />
        Note: This flag is only relevant for blukii beacons
        Parameters:
        scanBeaconSensorData - state if blukii beacon sensor data is scanned, default is true
        See Also:
        OutputElement, BeaconSensorData

      • setScanDuration

        public void setScanDuration(int scanDuration)
        Gets the duration of one discovery phase.

        After the scan duration has finished all scanned BLE data is saved into a List of OutputElement and returned by callback BlukiiClient.OnDiscoveryListener.onDiscoveryResult(ArrayList).

        See also getScanWaitDuration() and getBackgroundScanType() to optimize the discovery concerning power consumption.
        Parameters:
        scanDuration - scan duration in milliseconds, default is SCANDURATION_DEFAULT.
        See Also:
        getScanDuration(), BlukiiClient.OnDiscoveryListener.onDiscoveryResult(ArrayList), getScanWaitDuration(), getForegroundScanType(), getBackgroundScanType(), getScreenOffScanType()

      • setScanDurationMaxCount

        public void setScanDurationMaxCount(int scanDurationMaxCount)
        Maximum Number of scan durations after the Bluetooth LE scanner will be restarted!

        This value only takes affect since Android API 25!

        Up to Android API 24 the Bluetooth LE Scanner will be restartet every scan duration because of reliable scan result.

        Since Android 25 the Bluetooth LE scanner is limited to maximum 5 starts per 30 seconds. So the scanner is running continuously if no wait time is defined.

        By defining the scanDurationMaxCount you can limit the number of scan durations before the Bluetooth LE scanner is nevertheless restartet.
        Parameters:
        scanDurationMaxCount - number of scan durations, default is SCANDURATIONMAXCOUNT_DEFAULT.
        See Also:
        getScanDurationMaxCount(), setScanDuration(int)

      • setScanEddystoneData

        public void setScanEddystoneData(boolean scanEddystoneData)
        Sets the state if discovery should scan for Eddystone data.
        />
        If this flag is set OutputElement.getDiscoveryData() may contain a valid EddystoneData object.
        Parameters:
        scanEddystoneData - state if Eddystone data is scanned, default is false
        See Also:
        OutputElement, EddystoneData

        Parameters:

        See Also:

      • setScanMode

        public void setScanMode(int scanMode)
        Sets the scan mode concerning power consumption and scan frequency.

        The values are integer values derived from the ScanSettings class of the android.bluetooth.le library:
        • SCANMODE_LOWPOWER
        • SCANMODE_BALANCED
        • SCANMODE_LOWLATENCY
        Parameters:
        scanMode - scan mode, default is SCANMODE_BALANCED
        See Also:
        setScanMode(int), SCANMODE_LOWPOWER, SCANMODE_BALANCED, SCANMODE_LOWLATENCY, ScanSettings

      • setScanNonBlukiis

        public void setScanNonBlukiis(boolean scanNonBlukiis)
        Sets the state if discovery should also scan for non blukii BLE modules. Note: the majority of OutputElement data is only supported for blukii modules: BeaconSensorData, ResolveData and some value of DiscoveryData.
        EddystoneData and IBeaconData is also supported for non blukii modules.
        Parameters:
        scanNonBlukiis - state if non blukii BLE modules are scanned, default is false

      • setScanWaitDuration

        public void setScanWaitDuration(int scanWaitTime)
        Sets the wait duration between two discovery phases. You can use this feature to minimize power consumption if you do not need an continuous scan.

        You have to consider the following states to define when wait duration takes affect:
        • getForegroundScanType(): App is in foreground
        • getBackgroundScanType(): App is in background
        • getScreenOffScanType(): Device screen is off or locked
        Parameters:
        scanWaitTime - scan wait duration in milliseconds, default is SCANWAITDURATION_DEFAULT.
        See Also:
        getScanWaitDuration(), getScanDuration(), getForegroundScanType(), getBackgroundScanType(), getScreenOffScanType()

      • setScreenOffScanType

        public void setScreenOffScanType(int screenOffScanType)
        Sets the scheduling type of the scan if the app is on screen off (inclusive lock screen)

        The values are integer values and can be:
        • SCANTYPE_OFF: scan is off
        • SCANTYPE_ALTERNATE: after each scan duration scan is pause for one wait duration
        • SCANTYPE_CONTINUOUS: scan is continuously on
        Parameters:
        screenOffScanType - scan type, default for screen off is SCANTYPE_OFF
        See Also:
        getBackgroundScanType(), setForegroundScanType(int), setScreenOffScanType(int)
